page.title: 09WICHENFORD DAY CENTRE
page.content: Former district nurse{Nora Parson created the{Wichenford Day Centre}to offset loneliness among the housebound people of the area. The Day Centre was established in {1977,}and last year it moved from the Memorial Hall to the{disused School {Extension,}where it operates on {Mondays and Thursdays. {Elderly, lonely}and{handicapped}people are collected by cars from{21 parishes and spend the day, from{10.30 to 3.30 there; staff and drivers are umpaid. There are{36}people on the roll. Each subscribes{70p}for morning coffee, two course lunch, and activities. Lunches are cooked in{Worcester}by{WRVS}and delivered hot. Activites are{basket {making, crochet, leather, knitting, {cards, Bingo}and{raffles. The Centre runs on a{budget of Â£3000, all raised locally.
